First of all, while making college free would minimize the individual burden of student debt, it doesn't necessarily mean the cost of education disappears; instead, it would be shifted to taxpayers. 

Secondly, an influx of students to colleges may strain resources and dilute the quality of education if not managed carefully. Not to mention, this universal approach doesn't consider individual's unique career paths which may not require a traditional four-year degree. 

Lastly, making college free for everyone might lead to dropout rates' increase, as students with less academic commitment may take attendance less seriously when they aren't bearing the financial cost.

Could there be other ways to make education more accessible that would not necessitate making all colleges free? Consideration of more targeted financial aid, loan forgiveness programs, or more affordable educational paths like trade schools or community colleges might be a good place to start.
